intro: Triantha racemosa, commonly known as the clustered trianthus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Triantha racemosa typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
